bunpro.writeup: Thesuffix〜代is used for several different things. One of the most common uses is for highlighting someone's decade of age. In the same way that English says teens, twenties, and thirties. All that is required is adding代after the age (in tens), in Japanese.In addition to someone's decade of age,〜代can be used to express a chronological decade, such as the 1960's, 70's, or 80's. In these cases,年代will be used after the decade.Fun Fact代is also regularly seen when marking eras of time, or generations of people within a specific family/political position.

examples.english: I was scolded often when I was in my teens.

examples.japanese: 私は20代の頃に沢山旅行をしました。
examples.english: I traveled a lot in my twenties.

examples.japanese: 六十代の方はこちらにお並びください。
examples.english: People in their sixties, please line up over here.

examples.japanese: 80年代のファッションはかっこいい。
新生代は哺乳類時代とも言われています。
examples.english: The Cenozoic era is also known as the era of mammals.

examples.japanese: 第5代将軍徳川綱吉はとても有名な将軍です。
examples.english: The fifth shogun, Tokugawa Tsunayoshi, is a very famous shogun.

examples.japanese: 街頭インタビュー、通行人：「1980年代ころからここに住んでいます。」
examples.english: Street interview, passerby: 'I have been living here since (around) the 1980s.'

examples.japanese: 証人が警察官に言う：「泥棒は３０代半ばだったと思います。」
examples.english: A witness speaks to a policeman: 'I think that the thief was in their mid-thirties.'

examples.japanese: 新聞記事：「Xさんは昭和５０年代の終わりごろにお金持ちになった。」
examples.english: Newspaper article: 'Mr. X became rich toward the end of the 50s of the Showa era.'

examples.japanese: 漫画のナレーター：「イラめぐみは３０代前半で次長になった。」
examples.english: Manga narrator: 'Megumi Ira became vice-director in her early thirties. '

examples.japanese: 新聞記事：「２０１０年代の終わりからハイエンドスマホの値段が上がり始めた。」
examples.english: Newspaper article: 'High-end smartphone prices started growing since the late 2010s.'
